description.general: The s1kd-ls tool searches the current directory or specified directory trees and lists the file names of CSDB objects matching certain criteria. The files representing the CSDB objects must use either the standard S1000D file naming conventions, or the alternate naming convention supported by these tools using the -N option.

option.name: -0, --null
option.description: Output a null-delimited list of CSDB object paths.

option.name: -C, -D, -G, -L, -M, -P, -S, -U, -X
option.description: List comments, data modules, ICNs, data management lists, ICN metadata files, publication modules, SCORM content packages, data update files, and data dispatch notes respectively. If none are specified, -CDGLMPSUX is assumed.

option.name: -e, --exec <cmd>
option.description: Execute a command for each CSDB object instead of listing them. The string "{}" is replaced by the current CSDB object file name everywhere it occurs in the arguments to the command.

option.name: -h, -?, --help
option.description: Show the usage message.

option.name: -I, --inwork
option.description: Show only inwork issues of objects (inwork != 00).

option.name: -i, --official
option.description: Show only official issues of objects (inwork = 00).

option.name: -l, --latest
option.description: Show only the latest official/inwork issue of objects.

option.name: -N, --omit-issue
option.description: Assume that the files being listed do not include the issue info in their filenames, i.e. they were created using the -N option of the s1kd-new* tools.

option.name: -n, --other
option.description: List non-S1000D files.

option.name: -o, --old
option.description: Show only old official/inwork issues of objects.

option.name: -R, --read-only
option.description: Show only non-writable object files.

option.name: -r, --recursive
option.description: Recursively descend in to directories.

option.name: -w, --writable
option.description: Show only writable object files.

option.name: -7, --list
option.description: Treat input as a list of CSDB objects to process.

option.name: --version
option.description: Show version information.

option.name: <object>|<dir> ...
option.description: An optional list of objects or directories to operate on.

option.name: --dtdload
option.description: Load the external DTD.

option.name: --huge
option.description: Remove any internal arbitrary parser limits.

option.name: --net
option.description: Allow network access to load external DTD and entities.

option.name: --noent
option.description: Resolve entities.

option.name: --parser-errors
option.description: Emit errors from parser.

option.name: --parser-warnings
option.description: Emit warnings from parser.

option.name: --xinclude
option.description: Do XInclude processing.

option.name: --xml-catalog <file>
option.description: Use an XML catalog when resolving entities. Multiple catalogs may be loaded by specifying this option multiple times.
